info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 15 at 8:38AM CDT until May 15 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 AM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL MIAMI...CASS AND JACKSON COUNTIES... At 837 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Independence to near Harrisonville to 6 miles east of Drexel, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Blue Springs, Raytown, Grandview, Belton, Raymore, Grain Valley, Harrisonville, Pleasant Hill, Greenwood, Peculiar, Louisburg, North Kansas City, Sugar Creek, Lake Lotawana, Archie, Lake Winnebago and Lone Jack. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 1 and 29. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 470 between mile markers 0 and 16. Interstate 435 between mile markers 56 and 74. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
